channel.title: Comments on: Standalone MySQL Utilities Now GA! Includes running mysqlfailover as a daemon
channel.description: Database technologies - especially around scalability and High Availability

item.title: By: andrew
item.dc:creator: andrew
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/mysql-replication/standalone-mysql-utilities-now-ga-includes-running-mysqlfailover-as-a-daemon#comment-490833">Ravi</a>.
Maybe try setting the log level to <code>debug</code>?
Andrew.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Ravi.

Maybe try setting the log level to debug?

Andrew.

item.title: By: Ravi
item.dc:creator: Ravi
item.description: It seems like mysqlfailover as a daemon is not working. I have started the mysqlfailover as a daemon and it shows running from process level, but it is not showing any progress in the log file as suppose to report the health of master and slave. Any idea.
item.content:encoded: It seems like mysqlfailover as a daemon is not working. I have started the mysqlfailover as a daemon and it shows running from process level, but it is not showing any progress in the log file as suppose to report the health of master and slave. Any idea.

item.title: By: Confluence: SRS Integrační platforma
item.dc:creator: Confluence: SRS Integrační platforma
item.description:
<strong>Instalace</strong>
SHOW GRANTS FOR 'root'@'%'; The default is rpl:rpl
item.content:encoded:
Instalace

SHOW GRANTS FOR ‘root’@’%’; The default is rpl:rpl
